newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia former minister Baldwin to quit politics.
newsitem.headline: Australia former minister Baldwin to quit politics.

text.p: Former Australian Labor minister and current opposition frontbencher Peter Baldwin on Friday said he would quit parliament.

Baldwin, citing the need for new blood in the Labor party, said he would quit his current position as opposition finance spokesman and would not seek re-election for his Sydney seat at the next election.
Baldwin, 46, has been in the national parliament for 15 years, including six as a minister, and was a member of New South Wales state's upper house for seven years.
He was higher education and employment services minister and later social security minister under the former Labor government, which was dumped from power in March 1996.
